Yes, I agree.=A0 I also think Nobunaga was successful. Since I believe the =
Maeno scrolls are legit (as does Konan city itself), I believe a large part=
 of Nobunaga's success was due to his ability to utilize spies and sabotage=
 with both brutal and surgical results. 
=A0=A0 I do think that Nobunaga ma=
de a=A0key error (it does not take away from his success, but speaks to his=
 story being cut short) :
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0 - He pushed Sakuma away and let Akechi too close
=A0=A0=A0=
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0I really believ=
e that if he had not banished Sakuma --and with him the dismantling of Saku=
ma's intelligence network ( I know this factoid is controversial, but I hav=
e enough evidence that I believe it) --- he would have been able to anticip=
ate Akechi's move. I think that Oda's banishment of Sakuma and his son was =
a BAD idea..just bad. He pushed away those who were truly loyal and concern=
ed for him and kept people who "performed better", but really didn't care f=
or him.
=A0=A0=A0 This is a classic mistake... He traded loyalty for effeci=
ency... and as almost always happens, it destroys him.
=A0
=A0 * I want to =
note that the Hachisuka/Maeno network was, obviously, still present-- but d=
o not forget... that network belong to Oda THROUGH Hideyoshi...The Hachisuk=
a and Maeno served Hideyoshi first and foremost...=A0=A0 Oda used then THRO=
UGH Hideyoshi...=A0.. Sakuma's network was Sakuma's network, of course, but=
 evidence suggest Oda had more influence over it due to Sakuma's ties to No=
bunaga since childhood..etc.etc.etc.
=A0
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0

Just so. Asserting that thing=

 point; stating HOW they would have gone
